channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report E-2024090080
item.description:
Report E-2024090080

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 23, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon pails of sodium hydroxide were punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the two (2) damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. All sodium hydroxide impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER ON UNLOAD 97. THE LEAKER HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZARD LABEL. WEARING PROPER PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE CLEANED UP SPILL AND RETURNED TO CLERKS FO FURTHER PROCESSING.
